quote: The moon people do not eat by swallowing food but by smelling it. Their money is poetry - actual poems, written out on pieces of paper whose value is determined by the worth of the poem itself.
quote_letters: THE MOON PEOPLE DO NOT EAT BY SWALLOWING FOOD BUT BY SMELLING IT THEIR MONEY IS POETRY - ACTUAL POEMS WRITTEN OUT ON PIECES OF PAPER WHOSE VALUE IS DETERMINED BY THE WORTH OF THE POEM ITSELF
chat:
potentially - Capable of happening or existing. 

Clue: Full of possibilities.

abolished - To be rid of something.

Clue: Eliminated forever. 

uptown - A part of a city or town that is more upscale than the rest.

Clue: Fancy part of town. 

Lyndon - Proper noun.

Clue: The name of a person, place or thing.

Abbott - Proper noun.

Clue: A surname. 

utility - A service that is provided to the public.

Clue: Useful service. 

stereotypes - A widely accepted but oversimplified image or idea of a person or thing.

Clue: Simplistic categorization. 

towing - The act of pulling something behind a vehicle.

Clue: Transporting something. 

employee - A person employed for wages or salary, especially at nonexecutive level.

Clue: Paid worker. 

routine - A sequence of actions regularly followed.

Clue: Regular schedule. 

memoir - A historical account or biography written from personal knowledge.

Clue: Personal biography. 

offshoot - A person or thing that is a branch or secondary product of something else.

Clue: Secondary result. 

nephew - A son of one's brother or sister, or of one's brother-in-law or sister-in-law.

Clue: Brother's son. 

privileges - A special right or advantage available only to a particular person or group.

Clue: Exclusive right. 

awesome - Extremely impressive or daunting.

Clue: Amazing. 

lesbian - A homosexual woman.

Clue: Woman who loves women. 

attempted - To make an effort to achieve or complete something, especially without success.

Clue: Tried but failed. 

church - A building used for public Christian worship.

Clue: Place of worship. 

empowered - To give someone the authority or power to do something.

Clue: Authorize.
